title: Sorting Algorithm Race
description: Interactive MicroSim comparing the efficiency of four sorting algorithms (Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Insertion Sort, and Quick Sort) racing to sort identical arrays. Students observe real-time comparison and swap counts to understand Big-O notation in practice.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
Algorithms
Data Structures
learningObjective: Students will be able to compare the efficiency of different sorting algorithms by observing their operation counts and completion times on identical datasets.
learningObjectives: Understand how sorting algorithm race algorithms work
Visualize sorting algorithm race data structures and operations
Analyze the efficiency and behavior of sorting algorithm race
Experiment with parameters to observe their effects on sorting algorithm race
